definition: to go beyond one's authority/arrogation
generic word for peoples or states of south China or south Asia at different historical periods/abbr. for Vietnam 越南
to exceed/to climb over/to surpass/the more... the more
surname Quan
authority/power/right/(literary) to weigh/expedient/temporary

sentences.english: The judge exceeded his powers in criticizing a court of appeal.
sentences.chinese: 法官越权对上诉法院进行批评。

sentences.english: Locked flash drive will protect your data from unauthorized access.
sentences.chinese: 挂锁优盘可以防止你的数据被越权存取。

sentences.english: The doctrine of ultra vires in China is rooted in its planned economy ideology.
sentences.chinese: 中国的越权原则根植于计划经济的意识形态中。

sentences.english: You were exceeding your duty in opening those letters.
sentences.chinese: 你拆阅那些信件是越权了。

sentences.english: The state Supreme Court then ruled that the medical board had exceeded its prerogative in impeding state law.
sentences.chinese: 州最高法院遂裁决医学委员会已越权妨碍州法律。

sentences.english: The judge exceeded his powers in criticizing the court ofappeal.
sentences.chinese: 法官越权对上诉法院进行指摘抉剔。

sentences.english: They say Obama has simply overstepped his bounds.
sentences.chinese: 他们说，奥巴马总统越权操作。

sentences.english: However, the insurer may, in accordance with law, investigate the responsibility of the insurance agent that oversteps the authority delegated to it.
sentences.chinese: 但是保险人可以依法追究越权的保险代理人的责任。

sentences.english: Procedures for handling ultra vires transaction.
The insurer may pursue, in accordance with the law, liability of the insurance agent that acted ultra vires.
sentences.chinese: 保险人可以依法追究越权的保险代理人的责任。

definition: lit. to go beyond the sacrificial altar and take over the kitchen (idiom); fig. to exceed one's place and meddle in other people's affairs/to take matters into one's own hands
to usurp/to overstep one's authority
authority/power over others
to have no right/to have no authority
to act arbitrarily/to make decisions without consulting others
to use one's position for personal gain (idiom)
wrongdoing/failure to do one's duty
to abscond/to be absent without leave
abuse of power
to exceed one's authority/to go beyond the bounds of one's job
to neglect one's duty/dereliction of duty/malpractice
to use public office to avenge private wrongs
official authority used for private interests (idiom); to attain private ends by abusing public position
against orders/to disobey/to refuse to accept orders
to bend the law in order to favor one's relatives or associates (idiom)
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
